books.name: Harry Potter and The Chamber of Secrets
books.author: J.K. Rowling
books.label: Best Fiction
books.description: Harry Potter's summer has included the worst birthday ever, doomy warnings from a house-elf called Dobby, and rescue from the Dursleys by his friend Ron Weasley in a magical flying car! Back at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry for his second year, Harry hears strange whispers echo through empty corridors - and then the attacks start. Students are found as though turned to stone . Dobby's sinister predictions seem to be coming true.

comments.comment: JK Rowling did an outstanding job. Loved it!
comments.author: John Lemon

comments.comment: It is mind-boggling how a person can be so creative in terms of fiction.
comments.author: Paul McVites

comments.comment: Pheonix is the real hero in this book.
comments.author: Michael Jaikishan

comments.comment: Finished it on the first day itself. Was on the edge of my seat.
comments.author: Ringo Starry

books.name: The Monk Who Sold His Ferrari
books.author: Robin Sharma
books.label: Philosophical
books.description: The Monk Who Sold His Ferrari is a revealing story that offers the readers a simple yet profound way to live life. The plot of this story revolves around Julian Mantle, a lawyer who has made his fortune and name in the profession. A sudden heart-attack creates havoc in the successful lawyerâ€™s life. Jolted by the sudden onset of the illness, his practice comes to a standstill.

books.name: Beyond Order
books.author: Dr. Jordan Peterson
books.label: Best Seller
books.description: Now in this much-anticipated sequel, Peterson goes further, showing that part of life's meaning comes from reaching out into the domain beyond what we know, and adapting to an ever-transforming world. While an excess of chaos threatens us with uncertainty, an excess of order leads to a lack of curiosity and creative vitality.

comments.comment: Very verbose! Mind-boggling

books.label: History
books.description: Earth is 4.5 billion years old. In just a fraction of that time, one species among countless others has conquered it: us. In this bold and provocative book, Yuval Noah Harari explores who we are, how we got here and where we're going.

books.name: Animal Farm
books.author: George Orwell
books.label: Analogy
books.description: As humans get ousted from Manor Farm and animals take control, their utopian fantasy of running a farm on the basis of equality soon begins to crumble before their eyes. The rebellion of the animals, led by the two pigs, Napoleon and Snowball, gives way to corrupt practices that lead to unthinkable consequences.
